div.p: ¶ The Sum of the actes & decrees made by dyuers Byſhopes of Rome.

IN this lyttell Treatyle here folowyng yu mayſte beholde moſte Chriſten rea • r (as in a glas moſt clere and bryght) ye very vyſnomy, Image, Figure, Shape, and faſſiō, of our Popyſhe popettes whiche hathe named them ſelue Popes (whiche ye truthe to ſaye are Byſhoppes of Rome) how & in what thyng theyr great labors and paynes cōſyſteth Only in makynge of lawes to ſtabilyſhe theyr owne auctoryties, And in ſettynge vp longe Matyns and Maſſes, with Diriges & other patrynges, That at no tyme ther ſhulde be any place gyuē that Goddes worde ſhulde be preached to the comfort of them that are derelye bought with the bloude of our mercifull ſauiour Chriſt. Theſe are the myſty aungelles of Satan (yt Paule warneth vs of (whiche tranſfygureth them ſelues in to the ſymilitude & Image of the aungelles
of lyght. ¶ Here in mayſte thou alſo beholde nowe that all Ceremonies that at this day is vſed in the church, Are the Inſtitucions and ordinaunces of Men, and therfore not to be eſtemed of no ſuch valour, that Godes worde ſhulde gyue place to let theſe dom paterynges be miniſtred. But that all theſe ought to gyue place and clerely to be put awaye, when godes worde cōmeth to be lyuely and clerely preached, which the Lorde of Glory graunt to be, Amen

div.head: ¶ In the yere of our lorde god .C.x
div.p:
EVariſtus Byſhop of Rome ordey
•• d that if a Byſhop were accuſed by the comen people, it ſhulde not be receaued. ¶Item that a Byſhop whan he preacheth, ſhulde haue .viii. Deacons to wayght vpon hym.

div.head: ¶ In the yere of oure Lorde god .C.xix.
div.p:
¶ Alexander byſſhop of Rome ordeyned that they ſhulde be accurſed that dyd let any yt were ſent from ye See apoſtolicall
¶And yt a lay man ſhuld not ſewe none of the Clergye at the tēporall lawe vpō payne of excommunication. ☞ Item yt ones a day the Preſte ſhulde ſacrifyce the bodye of Chriſt. &c. ¶Item he added to ye Sacrifyce and memory, of the paſſion of Chriſt (Qui pridie ꝙ paterecur. &c.) to be ſayd vnto theſe wordes (Thys is my bodye. &c.) ¶Item he ordeyned that water ſhuld be myngled with ye wyne, & that it ſhuld be vnleuioned brede that was occupyed in ye oblation & not leuende bred as was afore. Alſo he ordeyned holy water to be made to fere dyuels a way wt al.

div.head: ¶In the yere of our lorde .C.xxix.
div.p: ¶Syxtus byſſhop of Rome, ordeyned yt no prophane creature or lay man ſhulde lay hondes on holy thynges. ¶ Alſo that ye corporas clothe ſhuld be of fyne lynyn. ¶And that the Maſſe ſhuld be celebrate vpon the auter, & that in it ſhuld be ſayd thryſe Sanctus.

div.head: ☞In the yere of our lorde .C.xxxix.
div.p: ☞Telleſphorus byſſhop of Rome, ordeyned the .xl. Dayes afore Eſter called lent to be faſted. Alſo yt a Preeſt vpō Criſtmas daye might cōſecrate thryſe, or thry maſſes. Alſo that Gloria in exelſis ſhuld be ſonge in the maſſe.

div.head: ¶In the yere of our lorde .C.xl.
div.p: ¶ Higinius Byſhop of Rome ordeyned that Solempne churches ſhulde be halowed wtout ſacrifice or without a maſſe. And yt the materiall thynges of the churche ſholde not be turned in Prophayne vſes. And yt a infant ſhule be preſented at Baptyme or confirmacion, or Biſhopynge be one man or one woman.

div.head: ☞ In the yere of our lorde .C.xliiii.
div.p:
☞ Pius Byſhop of Rome Ordeyned Eaſter daye to be celebrate vpon the ſonday. Alſo the payne that preſtes ſhuld haue if they neglected or let paſſe any parte of the Celebration. Alſo that none ſhuld ſwere nether by the here nor hed of god. Alſo maydens before. xxv. yere of age &
after the .xii. daye ſhulde not be conſecrated into religion. ¶And yt is ſacrilege raſhely to cauſe the profettes of the churche to be miniſhed nor the religious mē to be put out of fauor.

div.head: ¶ In the Iere of our lorde .C.lxvi.
div.p: ¶ Sater Byſſhop of Rome ordeyned ye a preeſte ſhuld not ſay maſſe or ſacrifyce except ii. Folkes at the leaſte were preſent. And that nūnes ſhuld not coche the corporas clothe the Chalyce nor the kyuerynge of the chalys. And that Nūnes ſhall not Sacrifice in the tyme of ſeruice. Item that a bleſſynge Preſte be preſent, at the tyme of matrymony, Item that a mayde be gyuen to her huſbande ſolempni of her father or mother or other frendes. Item yt a vnlawful othe is to be broken. Item ye vpon Mawndy, thueſday men ſhuld receaue the ſacrament.

div.head: ¶ In the yere of our lorde .C.lxivii.
div.p:
¶ Eleuterius byſhop of Rome ordened yt no meate ſhuld be forſaken thorown a
ſuperſticious name. That no mā ſhuld be purdowne from theyr, dygnyte. But if they be fyrſt accuſed and then conuicted. He that is gyltye & abſent ſhall not be condempned though hys acccuſor cal vpon hym. Vnder this byſhop ye Brytaynes receyued the fayth of Chriſt.

div.head: ¶ In the yere of our lorde .C.lxxxxii.
div.p: ¶ Victor byſhop of Rome ordeyned that Eſter day ſhuld be Celebrate on the ſonday after the .xiiii daye of the mone of the .i. Moneth. Alſo yt euery mā of neceſſite requyred myght be baptyſed whē he pleaſe. And that thoſe yt wolde not be recō ſyled from theyr olde malyce, they ſhuld be excōmunicate from the ſeruyce of god.

div.head: ¶ In the yere of our lorde .CC.iii.
div.p: ¶ Seuerinus ordeyned yt the ſacrament ſhuld be cōſecrate in a chalyce of Glaſſe & not of tre, as a fore. ☞ Alſo that Chriſtē people ſhuld reſcyue the ſacramēt on Eſter day at ye laeſt. And yt preſtes ſhuld be wt the Byſhop when he ſaythe maſſe

div.head: ☞In the yere of our lorde .CC.xii.
div.p: ☞ Calixtus ordeyned, that the ymbryng dayes ſhulde be faſted that whete, wyne & oyle myght be encreaſe. ☞ And that thoſe whiche ſhuld take orders ſhuld abſtayne from wyues for euer, Item that a byſhop ſhuld not be cōſecrated but yf he were lawfully choſe. That preſtes ſhold not be accuſed by defamed ꝑſons. That accuſars of clarckes, yf they be ſuſpecte enemies, they ſhal not be admitted in the courte or lawe. ☞ Alſo that the hurters of pylgryms ſhulde be accurſed.

div.head: ☞ In the yere of our lorde .CC.lii.
div.p:
☞ Fabian ordeyned the holy oyle ſhulde be reuyued euery yere. And yt the olde ſhulde be brēt on maūdy thurſday. That cryſten people ſhulde receyue the ſacrament thryſe a yere. Alſo that no man ſhulde loke to ye preſtes lyuing but ſhuld herken to his doctryne & thoſe thynges that he mynyſtrythe. In that clarkes that are gylte ſhulde be punyſhed by the
lawe of the chyrche. Item that thoſe yt reproueth wrōgfully and clark, ſhulde be a curſed. That no man ſhulde take a wyfe within .v. degre of bloude.

div.head: ☞In the yere of our lorde .CC.lv.
div.p: ☞ Cornelius ordeyned yt no man ſhuld conſtrayne a preſte to ſwere but in a matter Of the fayth. That thoſe which are put vnto theyr others, by the order of the lawe ſhuld be faſtynge.

div.head: ☞In the yere of our lorde .CC.lxi.
div.p: ☞Stephanus ordeyned ye clarkes ſhuld not were the veſtamentes of the churche but in the miniſtracion of holy thynges. Item thoſe yt take away ye goodes of the church ſhalbe cōdempned as mēſlayers. Thoſe that haue lefte the fayth, and are penytēt ſhal not be baptyſed agayne.

div.head: ☞In the yere of our lord .CC.lxiiii.
div.p: ☞ Sixtus ordeyned yt a preeſt ſhulde ſacrifyſe vpon a halowed altare & he gaue vnto ſaynt Laurence the treaſure of the churche to dyſtrybute.

div.head: In the yere of our lord .CC.lxxiii.
div.p: Helix ordeyned holy dayes yerely in remēbraunce of martyrs. He renewed conſecraciōs & halowynges of chyrches that preſtes ſhulde not ſaye maſſe but in holy place onely.

div.head: In the yere of our lord .CC.lxxvii.
div.p: EVticianus ordeyned that thoſe yt geld thēſelues, & thoſe yt are buggerers & abbates yt preſume to defyle virgyns ſhuld be excōmunicat. That newe frutes ſhuld be bleſſed vpon ye auter Itē yt a marter ſhuld be beryed in a cope.

div.head: In the yere of our lorde .CC.lxxxv.
div.p: Catus ordeyned that they ſhuld aſſend by vii. diſtynet orders to be a byſhop. Itē yt no lay man nether heretycke nor vnbaptyſed mā ſhal cal a clarck to ye lawe.

div.head: In the yere of our lorde .CC.lxxxxvii.
div.p: Marcellinus for feare of payne cōmitted Idolatrye & afterwarde dyd penaūce and ye time ther was xvii.M.i.xxx. dais marterd by Dyocleſyan the Emperour.

div.head: ☞In the yere of our lorde .CCC.vi.
div.p: Marcellus was ye fyrſt that gaue tytles to paryſhes and dyoces in Rome.

div.head: In the yere of our lord .CCC.xi.
div.p: Euſebius ardeyned yt thoſe that takyth away any thynge praynyng to ye church ſhall reſtore .x. tymes aſmoche agayne, Itē that preſtes ſhuld not be accuſed but of men of gret grauyte. The workers of witchcraft & defamed perſons ſhall not be receaued as witneſſes. Alſo a woman yt is ſpouſed to her huſband may departe from hym & go into Religion.

div.head: In the yere of our lorde .CCC.xiii.
div.p: Melacides ye laſt marter from Peter ordeyned yt no man ſhuld faſt on ſonday or thurſdaye. That no man ſhuld be condempned of ſuſpicion before the dede be proued. That a clarck ſhuld abſtayne frō ſeculer buſines.

div.head: In the yere of our lorde .CCC.xvii.
div.p:
Sylueſter Ordeyned yt the holy oyle ſhuld be conſecrated by a byſhop. And ye
chyldren beyng baptyſed ſhuld be confyrmed by a byſhop. Item yt preſtes ſhulde a noynt ſyk folkꝭ. Item yt wenſday fryday and ſaterday ſhuld be faſted. Item yt preſtes may not be called of a lay man into no law. Item yt a preſt ſhuld not be aturne in ye temporall lawe. Itē yt preſtes ſhuld were no ſylk in clothꝭ. Itē yt he ſhall haue no dyed corporas cloth. Alſo he was ye fyrſt yt cauſed a deacon to put a cope on hym in tyme of maſſe and a fanon on hys left hande

div.head: ¶ In the yere of our lord .CCC.xxxviii.
div.p: ☞Marcus ordeyned yt the crede ſhuld be long a loft after ye goſpel. That a clark ſhuld not be brought to the tēporal law.

div.head: ¶ In the yere of our lorde .CCC.lxxiii.
div.p:
¶Damaſus ordeyned that the confite or ſhuld be ſayd at ye beginnyng of ye maſſe. Alſo he cauſed fyrſt ye deuiſion of ye quere ye one ſhuld ſyng on verſe on ye one ſyde and ye other on ye other ſyde. And yt gloria patti ſhuld be ſonge at the ende of euery
pſalme. Alſo yt thoſe ye brek his canon lawe ſhulde be counted as blaſphemers of ye ſpirit. He gaue autorite to .ſ. Ieromꝭ wrytyngꝭ He ordeyned ye goſpel & piſtle to be red in ye maſſe He wryt ye lyues of his p̄deceſſors & many lawes. In hys tyme ye counſel of Conſtantinople was

div.head: ☞In the yere of our lorde .CCC.xC.
div.p: ¶ Siricius ordeyned yt orders ſhuld be gyuen dyuerſe tymes of the yere. And yt Pryſtes ſhuld be made by the byſſhoppꝭ only. And yt pryſtes ſhuld not dwell wt no womē, But they were nye kynne to them. Alſo yt no man Maryinge a wydowe ſhulde not be preſte.

div.head: ¶ In the yere of our lorde .CCCC.v.
div.p: ¶Anaſtaſius, ordeyned yt men ſhuld ſtā de vp at ye readyng of the goſpel & here it in remembraunce. Item that thoſe yt lacked any of theyr members, or partꝭ of theyr bodyes ſhuld not be made pryſtꝭ.
Alſo he ordeyned fyrſte the Order of ſaynct Hierome.

div.head: ¶In the yere of our lord iiii.C.viii.
div.p: Innocentius ordeyned ye Saterdayes ſhuld be faſted. A church ons halowed ſhuld not be halowed agayn. Item that a ſtatute made of the clargy without the cōſent of the byſhop ſhulde be as voyde. Item that it ſhalbe counted Simonye to them that ſolde Prebendes, dignityes or of holy Oyle. Itē on Solempne feaſtes thoſe that are Chriſten people ſhuld afore that they receyue the ſacramēt gyue eche other a kyſſe of peace.

div.head: In the yere of our lorde .iiii.C.xxiiii.
div.p: Sozinus ordeyned yt the paſchall taper ſhulde be halowed in euery paryſhe on Eſter euen. Item that clarkes ſhulde not drynke in tauernes. Item yt prē tyſes ſhuld not take orders.

div.head: In the yere of our lord .iiii.C.xxxiii.
div.p: Bonefacius ordeined yt no man ſhuld be made a preſte before .xxx. yere & that ye ſeruaunte that ranne awaye from hys maſter ſhuld not be receyued to a pryſte.

div.head: In the yere of our lorde .iiii.C.xliii.
div.p: Leo ordeyned that in baptyme and cō fyrmacyon we ſhuld haue one god father Item yt in ſeptuageſime & quadrageſyme and aduente, Alleluya ſhuld not be ſong nor gloria in excelſis. He ordeyned hanc igitur to be ſayd, in the canō of the maſſe Item yt a Byſhop of Viā called Mamarcus inſtituted the Latony to be ſonge.

div.head: In the yere of our lord .iiii.C.lxiii.
div.p: Hilarius ordeyned yt byſhopes ſhuld not choſe thē ſucceſſors This byſhop gathered al ye decrees of his p̄deceſſors into one boke & publyſhed thē to all ye world.

div.head: In the yere of our lord .v.C.xxv.
div.p: Iohn ye .i. ordeyned yt the Emperours ſhuld be ſubiectꝭ vnto ye byſhopes & not to bere rule ouer thē. In yt tyme the holynes of Bn̄d • e was ī ye exſtemaciō which ordeined the Relion of monkes. Whiche thenſeforth was deuyded in many houſholdes.

div.head: In the yere of our lorde .v.C.xxxii.
div.p:
Bonyface ye .ii. ordeyned that the lay
people ſhuld here theyr diuine ſeruice in a ſeuerall place from the clergye.

div.head: ¶ In the yere of our lorde .v.C.lvi.
div.p: ☞Pelagius .i. ordeyned yt preſtes ſhuld ſay theyr canonicall houres dayly. And that ī the tyme of lent they ſhulde not celebrate before they had ſayd ye laſt hour. And yt ther ſhal not be admitted ī the ſpirituall courte no lybell of accuſation on leſſe the party accuſed be preſent. Alſo yt ſeiſmatykes & heretikes ſhuld be oppreſſed with the ſeculer power.

div.head: ¶In the yere of our lord .v.C.xCii.
div.p:
¶Gregory ye great wrote fyrſt himſelfe in his letter ī theſe wordes ſeruus ſeruerum yt is the ſeruaūt of al ſeruaūtes. In ye ſinode of ye .xxiiii. fathers he confyrmed opēly .iiii. general coūcellꝭ. He brought into the church ornamentes & ſyngyng. He ordeyned that the maſſe ſhuld begin wt a verſe of ye ſpalter. And that kyrieleyſon ſhuld be repeted .ix. tymes. He ordeyned Alleluya to be ſayd alſo ye offertorye
he ordeyned & in ye canon of ye maſſe to be ſayd. Deꝰ q nr̄os. &c. & after ye canō of ye d •… ical oraciō to be ſayed ouer ye hoſte. at ye houres he ordeyned Deꝰ ī adiutoriū to be ſayd wt gloria pr̄i. And yt the laſt wyll of thē yt died ſhuld be kept & ratified. And yt the .iiii. dayes before the fyrſt ſonday intent ſhuld be faſted, Alſo yt mē maryed to ii. wiues & vſerers ſhuld not be admitted to be preſtꝭ. Itē yt mē leuing theyr wiuꝭ wt cōſent yt their wiues ought thē to enter īto religiō, And alſo wemē leuīg their huſbāde with cōſent their huſbādꝭ ought alſo to enter īto religiō. Alſo yt their ſhal not be ii. metropolitās ī one ꝓuēce, This mā cōmaūdeth to prechers yt they ſhuld vſe deſcreſſiō both ī ſpeking & in keping of ſilēs. ¶And he belded .vi. monaſteries our of ye groūde of his owne coſt And he mayd his owne houſe a Religious houſe And like him ſhal ye ſkan • fynde any.✚

div.head: ¶ In the yere of our lorde .vi.C.v.
div.p:
Sabinus ordeined yt the houres of ye day
ſhuld be made knowē vnto ye church bi ye diſtinctiō of ye ryngīg of bellꝭ And yt thee ſhuld lāpes cōtinually burne ī ye church.

div.head: ☞In the yere of our lorde .vi.C.vii.
div.p: Boniface ye .iii. ordeyned yt the corporas cloth at ye cōſecratiō ſhuld belayde abrode by ye preſt & that none ſhuld be elected ī ye place of the dede byſhop, But ye .iii. day after hys deth, And yt nether for fauor nor for no mony. And yt the electiō ſhulde be made bothe of ye clargy & lay people, and yt it ſhuld be ratyfyed by chaſſent of ye byſhop. This man by ye cōſent of Focas obtayned agaīſt ye patriarke of cōſtātinople That ye ſee of Peter ſhulde be the hede of the churche.

div.head: ¶In the yere of our Lorde .vi.C.viii.
div.p:
Boniface ye .iiii. he dedicated ye tēpyl of Gybel & of ye gentyles vnto our lady & al ſayntes. ¶He made his fathers howſe a monaſtery, and the londes of his auncetry he gaue vnto the vſe of the Mōkes. And than gaue vnto them auctorite to
preache, to baptyſe and to abſoyle.

div.head: ¶In the yere of our Lorde .vi.C.xv.
div.p: Theodatꝰ ye .i. ordeyned yt no mā ſhulde mary that Mayde that his father had bē god father to. ¶This man loued ye clargye and pore people ardently.

div.head: ¶In the yere of our lorde .vi.C.xviii.
div.p: Boniface the .v. ordeyned that thoſe the came to the church for ſocor, ſhuld not be taken from them with violēce. And that thoſe ye cōmitted Sacrilege ſhuld in euery place be cōuicted & accurſed. And ye teſtamentes made by ye Princes ſhuld by all maner of wayes ſtāde in ful ſtrength.

div.head: ¶In the yere of our lorde .vi.C.xxiii.
div.p: Honoriꝰ ye .i. ordeyned yt the names of ye excomūicat ſhuld be opēly denoūſed, this mā did reſtore many churchꝭ & church yerdes. And he apointed lawes to ye ſaraſēs.

div.head: ¶In ye yere of our lord .vi.C.xxxviii.
div.p: Iohn̄ the .iiii. ordeyned that any inuaded or toke away the godes of the church He ſhuld reſtore .iiii. folde.

div.head: ☞ In the yere of our lorde .vi.C.xl.
div.p: Theodorus Ordeyned the halowynge of waxe as Sozinus writyth of hym, & bylded vp .ii. Celles in Rome.

div.head: ¶ In the yere of our lorde .vi.C.xlvi.
div.p: Martyne ye .i. ordeyned yt they ſhuld not haue no lōg here. And yt ye mā & his wyfe ſhulde be bleſt before they laye together. And yt the byſhop euery yere ſhuld make creme & ſend it to euer • pariſhe of ye diocꝭ.

div.head: ☞In the yere of our lorde .vi.C.liii.
div.p: Egenius the .ii. ordeyned that the Byſhop ſhuld haue pryſons, to ponyſhe ye of fenders of the Clarge. Alſo that ye preſtꝭ howſes ſhulde be bylded nere ye churche.

div.head: ¶In the yere of our lorde .vi.C.lvi.
div.p: Vitilianus made ye order of ye churches He ordeyned ſonge & added to ye organs.

div.head: ¶In the yere of our lorde .vi.C.lxv.
div.p: Theodarus ye .ii. bylded churches. He ordeined many ſuffrages to put away many wonders yt hapened ī thoſe dayes.

div.head: ☞In the yere of our lorde .vi.C.lxxi.
div.p: Donus ye .i. ordeyned ye clergye into diuerſe degrees. He made ye church of Rauē na to be obediēt vnto ye church of Rome.

div.head: ☞In the yere of our lord .vi.C.lxxx.
div.p: Agatho in counſell of .ii.C.lxxxix. byſhopꝭ vnied & accorded ye latyns & the grekes in ye Eccleſiaſticall Ceremoniꝭ & maner of ſacrifices. He cōdempned for an he re • ke Marcharius ye byſhop of Antioche This was the .vi. generall counſell.

div.head: ☞In the yere of our lord .vi.C.lxxxiiii.
div.p: Leo ye .ii. ordeyned Baptyme to be done in vrgent neceſſite. He ordeyned ye Pax to be borne about to the people beyng preſent a Maſſe. Alſo that the eleccion of ye clergy of Rauēna which made hymſelfe Equall wt Rome ſhuld not be in ſtrēgth but yf ye byſhop of Rome, dyd a proue in Thys man ordeyned the pſalmody, and he brought ye hymmꝭ īto aſwere tewne.

div.head: ☞In the yere of our lorde .vi.C.lxxxv.
div.p:
Benedicte ye .ii. a mā of mooſt hye holynes, whoſe holines moued Cōſtātyne to
make him to be ye very vyear of Chriſt in erth, whō ye clargy & the people of Rome did make byſhop, by ye autorite of ye comō hawſe wtout any cōfyrmaciō of ye prince.

div.head: ☞In ye yere our Lorde. vi.C.lxxxvi.
div.p: Iohn̄ ye .v. was cōſecrated of .iii. byſhopes & ſo made a decre that the ſame maner of conſecracion ſhuld be obſerued of his ſucceſſours.

div.head: ☞In ye yere of our lorde .vi.C.lxxxviii.
div.p: Sergius ye .i. ordeyned Agnus dei to be ſayd of ye preſte in ye Maſſe before ye breakyng of ye hoſte, which peeꝭ of ye hoſte He declared ye ſignificatiō ī a certayne canō. This mā brought ye church of Aquila to his dutie, which did lytel alowe ye .v. coū ſell.

div.head: ☞In ye yere of our lord .vii.C.i.
div.p: Iohn̄ the .vi. redemed many yt were in captiuite, & garnyſhed ye church. And in tyme was Bede and Heymo.

div.head: ☞In the yere of our Lorde .vii.C.iiii.
div.p: Iohn̄ ye .vii. garnyſhed many churches with pycrueres and Images of ſayntes.

div.head: ¶ In the yere of our lorde .vii.C.vi.
div.p: Sizimus hauynge the gowte bothe in handes and feete, dyed ſodeynly.

div.head: ¶ In the yere of our lorde .vii.C.vii.
div.p: Conſtantyne ye .i. ordeyned yt the Images of ſaynctes whiche we raſed oute by Philyp in the tempyll of Sophye ſhulde agayne be paynted in the porche of ſaynt Peter, And he ordyned that ye name of thy Heretyke Emperour ſhuld not be receyued nother in open nor pryuate wrytinges nether in Braſſe, Syluer or lead,

div.head: ¶ In the yere of our lorde .vii.C.xiiii.
div.p: Gregory ye .ii. cōuerted ye germaynes to ye fayth by his diligēce. He excōmūicated Leo ye Emperour to be an heretike. Here payred ye churchꝭ & the wallꝭ of ye Citie.

div.head: In the yere of our lorde .vii.C.xxxi.
div.p:
Gregory ye .iii. ordeyned the Images of ſaynctes to be worſhypped. And them to be Excōmunicated yt dyd violate theym. This man wt a counſell of a. M Byſhopes, & with thaſſent of the clargye, & alſo of the
people dyd depryue Leo bothe of his Impery and alſo of the company of good mē Becauſe Leo had raſed out of ye chuches the forſayde Images and broke thē downe. He decked ye churches & reſtored monaſteries. And he added to the Canon of the maſſe theſe wordes (Quorū hodie ſolemnitas. &c.) But they do not vſe thoſe wordes now in ye Secretes of the maſſe.

div.head: ¶ In the yere of our lorde .vii.C.xlii.
div.p: Sacharias ordeyned ye men of ye clarge ſhuld were no ſeculer habytes.

div.head: ¶In the yere of our lorde .vii.C.lxviii.
div.p: Steuen ye .iii. ordeyned yt no man ſhuld be made a biſhop excepte he were wtin orders before. And yt ymages which were taken away by ye coūſell of Cōſtantyne: ſhulde be reſtored to the church agayne-

div.head: ¶In the yere of our Lorde .viii.C.xvii.
div.p: Paſcalis the .i. ordeyned that no ſeculer man ſhulde preſume to take a benefice.

div.head: ¶In the yere of our lorde .viii.C.xxvii.
div.p:
Gregory the forth ordeyned the feeſte of
all Halowes.

div.head: ¶In the yere of our lorde .viii.C.xliii.
div.p: Sergius the .ii. (whiche was called the mouth of a Swyne) for ye vnclene ſoūde of his voyce. He toke to hym this name Sergius, And of this mā al other byſhopes of Rome hath taken occaſion to chaū ge their name. Thys man ordeyned that all ſayntes and holy mē ſhuld be buryed Soūteouſly with Tombes and ſhrines.

div.head: ¶In the yere of our lorde .viii.C.xlvi.
div.p: Leo the .iiii. ordeyned yt a byſhop ſhuld not be accuſed wt leſſe thā .lxxii. witneſſꝭ

div.head: ¶In the yere of our Lorde .viii.C.liiii.
div.p: Iohn̄ the .viii. a woman (as they ſay) very well lerned. She ſhewed herſelfe outwardly to be a man, And ſhe being great with chylde was delyuered in profeſſion in the rogation dayes, and ſtrayght way ſhe dyed: and her chylde with her.

div.head: ¶In the yere of our lord .viii.C.lvi.
div.p:
Benedicte the .iii. ordeyned yt the clarge ſhuld ſynge Dirige for theyr ſuperiours
and agayne the ſuperiours to ſynge dirī ge for the clargye.

div.head: ☞In the yere of our lorde .ix.C.xiiii.
div.p: Anaſtaſius the thyrde affyrmed the order of the Rule of Benet,

div.head: ☞In the yere of our lorde .ix.C.xCv.
div.p: Gregory the fyfte ordeyned that only ye Germaynes ſhulde choſe the Emperour for he was a Saxon borne.

div.head: ¶ In ye yere of our lord .ix.C.lxxxxviii.
div.p: Sylueſter the ſecond was made byſhop of Rome by Dyuelyſhe congeringe and He aſked the deuyll how longe he ſhuld lyue and he ſhewed hym ſo longe as he came not to Hieruſalem. And Sylueſter ſaying maſſe in a chapell of ye holy croſſe called Hieruſalem, dyd perſeaue his laſte day was come, and than he ſhewed how he was made byſhop by congeracion.

div.head: ¶In the yere of our lorde .M.ii.
div.p: Iohn̄ the .xix. ordeyned all Sollen day to be next after all halon daye.

div.head: ¶In the yere of our lorde .M.xlviii.
div.p: Damaſius the ſecond poyſond Clemēt the ſeconde, & ſtrayght wtout any electiō toke vpon hym to be in the Se of Rome

div.head: ¶In the yere of our lorde .M.lxiii
div.p: Gregorye the ſeuenthe Ordeyned that Monkes ſhulde eate no fleſh.

div.head: ¶In the yere of our lorde .M.lxxxviii.
div.p: Vrban the ſecond ordeyned that Clarkes ſhuld ſaye our Lady matyns euerye daye and that her ſeruice ſhuld be on the Saterday and yt no preſtes ſonne ſhuld haue no offyce in the churche.

div.head: ¶In the yere of our lorde .M.c.xcix.
div.p: Innocentius the thyrde ordeyned that they that take theyr rightes ſhuld be cō feſſed, euery yere ons at the leſt at Eſter

div.head: ¶In the yere of our lorde .M.CC.xvi.
div.p: Honorius the thyrde dyd confyrme the orders of Dominike and Franſis.

div.head: ¶In the yere of our Lorde .M.cc.xxvii.
div.p:
Gregory ye .ix. made Dominike & Frā cis & one of his kynſmē Antony & Elizabeth ſayntes, He ſet fourthe alſo the
Decritalles cōpyled by one Raimundꝰ.

div.head: ¶In the yere of our lord .M.iiC.xliii.
div.p: Innocencius the fourthe ordeyned that the Natyuite of our lady ſhuld be kepte. viii. dayes, and that Cardynalles whan they ryde on horſbacke ſholde were a red hat. He gaue religeous men priuileges and wrote the rule of ſaynt Clare.

div.head: ¶In the yere of our lorde .M.iiC.lvi.
div.p: Alexander the fourthe Ordeyned that ſeculer power to requyre of no Chyrche nether of man of the churche any taſkes or deme, and that lay men ſhulde not dyſpute of fayth. He made Clare a Saynte, & gaue lycens to the Hermytes to dwell in the Cytyes.

div.head: ¶In the yere of our lorde .M.cc.lxii.
div.p: Vrbanus the fourthe ordeyned the reſte of corpus Chriſt: the wh • che Tomas of Aquyne dyd make and compyle.

div.head: ¶In the yere of our lorde .M cc.lxxxvi.
div.p:
Honorius the forthe approued the order of whyte freers, the whiche at that tyme
was not approued by any coūſayle and chaunged ther vttermoſt blacke cope into whyte.

div.head: ¶In the yere of our lorde .M.cc.xcv.
div.p: Bonifacius the Eyght ordeyned permutacions of Benefytes, And the maner of dyſgrading of clarkes. And that clarkes ſhulde haue wyues, and they to kepte theyr gownes and heddes to be ſhauen as was before, and they to haue al priuileges as they hath before, and he made all the clargy free from all maner of Exactyons of the Temporalte. And he ordeyned the diſgradynge of clarkes, and perpetuall priſonment.

div.head: ¶In the yere of our Lorde .M.ccc.xvii.
div.p: Iohn̄ the .xxiii. Dyd declare the Order of the Graye freers, and made Thomas Aquyne, and Thomas the byſhop of Herten Saynctes:

div.head: ¶ In the yere of our lorde .M.ccc.lxxx.
div.p:
Vrbanus the .vi. Made on one daye. xxix. Cardinalles, ☞ And he made Viſitacion
of our lady holy daye.

div.head: ¶In the yere of our lord .M.iiii.xlviii,
div.p: Nycholas the fyfte made amonge diuerſe other Bernardyne a Saynt.

div.head: ¶ In the yere of our lorde .M.iiii.c.lvi.
div.p: Calixtus dyd ordeyne the feaſte ye tranſfiguracion of our lord, And he made Vincent a Saynt.

div.head: ☞In the yere of our lorde .cccc.C.lix.
div.p: ☞Pius the ſeconde made Katherine a ſaynt.

div.head: ¶ In the yere of our lorde .M.cccc.lxv.
div.p: Paule the ſeconde ordeyned that they yt dyd allyenat, or withdrawe any thynge from ye church ſhuld be excōmunicated.

div.head: ☞In the yere of our lord .M.cccc.lxxii.
div.p: Sixtus the fourthe ordeyned the feeſtes of ye Conception and preſentation of our lady and the feaſtes of Anne Franſis, & Ioſephe, And brought backe the yere of Iubilee to the yere of, xxv: And he dyd make Bonauenture a Saynt.

div.head: ☞In ye yere of our lord .M.cccc.lxxxvi
div.p: Innocentius the .viii. made Heliopolde a Saynt.

q.p:
☞The lorde of glory) hath ſent his miniſters to plage the beſt, with her adherē tes whiche hath her marke, and vpon al
them which worſhypped her ymage that ſhe nor her chyldrē ſhuld no more ſhedde the bloude of the chyldrē of ſaluacion wt her gret burdyns of tradiciōs.

div.p: ¶Tranſlated out of latyn into Englyſhe, And Imprynted in ye houſe of Thomas gybſon.
